page.title: 04Footpaths
page.content:
In the last two to three years, a {network of footpaths}has been built along the cliffs from Bonne Nuit (block to the east) to Bouley Bay jetty (block to the south). These are part of the island network designed to go all around the cliffs.
Dr{John Renouf,}of the Education Department's advisory srvice, is one of those whol thinks that the path makers have been too thorough. They have cut paths along both the upper{and}lower stretches of remote cliff which were natural wild life sanctuaries. With very little more thought such sensitive areas could have been avoided while yet maintaining the coverage of the coastal fringe. A {public protest}prevented a path from being built in part of this block.
